metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1886 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-athena - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-common - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-motif - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-nox - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
xxd - 8.2.5166-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> issue added in 8.2.3677 and 8.2.3678, with commits https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4d07253a and https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/85be8563. So, first added in jammy (based on 8.2.3995)

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.2.5166-0ubuntu1').
